pull.title: test: Verify if wallet is compiled in rpc_invalid_address_message.py test
pull.body:
Most of  `test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py` does not requires wallet.
But if the project is compiled in disable-wallet mode, the entire test will be skipped.


This PR changes the test to run the RPC tests first and then checks if the wallet is compiled.

events.body:
concept ACK
there are 2 subtests and only one requires wallet, this PR enables the other one to run even with disabled wallet.
although instead of splitting can add an if condition (using self.is_wallet_compiled()) in runtests.

- Makes sense to split in two file. There are 2 subtests and only one requires wallet as @Shubhankar-Gambhir sayd.

- `self.skip_if_no_wallet()` calls to [self.is_wallet_compiled()](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/test/functional/test_framework/test_framework.py#L817). Inside bitcoin functional tests, `self.skip_if_no_wallet()` is mainly used (77 times) and self.is_wallet_compiled() (16 times). I think that `self.is_wallet_compiled()` is used for some special cases and this one is not one of them. So, `self.skip_if_no_wallet()` is better.

- ACK ([90e382b5123ae97dc8f536e847ca790e21467446](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22794/commits/90e382b5123ae97dc8f536e847ca790e21467446))

- Tests I have done:

   - Run tests on compiled bitcoin with PR changes and wallet:
   ```sh
   $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.334000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_q38ex0pf
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.648000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.803000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_q38ex0pf on exit
   2021-08-27T19:39:18.803000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful

   $ test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:40:12.106000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_f3rhiwtn
   2021-08-27T19:40:12.563000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
  2021-08-27T19:40:12.669000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_f3rhiwtn on exit
  2021-08-27T19:40:12.669000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
   ```
   - Run tests on compiled bitcoin with PR changes but without wallet (--disable-wallet):
   ```sh
   $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:34:27.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ahdk12up
   2021-08-27T19:34:28.115000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-27T19:34:28.271000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_ahdk12up on exit
   2021-08-27T19:34:28.271000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful

   $ test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.719000Z TestFramework (WARNING): Test Skipped: wallet has not been compiled.
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_2hs3yym1 on exit
   2021-08-27T19:34:38.769000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test skipped
   ```
   - Run tests on compiled bitcoin from master without wallet (--disable-wallet):
   ```sh
   $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.242000Z TestFramework (WARNING): Test Skipped: wallet has not been compiled.
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.294000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.294000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_mif2y1xy on exit
   2021-08-28T23:38:12.294000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test skipped

   $ test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py
   bash: test/functional/wallet_invalid_address_message.py: File or folder does not exist
  ```

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22794/commits/90e382b5123ae97dc8f536e847ca790e21467446

verified the correct tests run as expected with and without wallet compiled. you may want to add a note indicating this is "move only" to the commit or pr description. it helps reviewers know what they should be looking for

I think it is acceptable to use `is_wallet_compiled` here to conditionally execute the tests. For test coverage it will be no difference.

Downside is that wallet-rpcs are mixed with non-wallet-rpcs in the same file, but the benefit would be that the same node can be used to run the tests without restart (should be faster).

Just in case i was not clear earlier the below patch would achieve the same 
<details>
<summary>patch</summary>

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py b/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
index e362642f0..6b92b2fe1 100755
--- a/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
+++ b/test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py
@@ -29,9 +29,6 @@ class InvalidAddressErrorMessageTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 1
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
-
     def test_validateaddress(self):
         node = self.nodes[0]
 
@@ -87,7 +84,10 @@ class InvalidAddressErrorMessageTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.test_validateaddress()
-        self.test_getaddressinfo()
+
+        # skip if wallet is disabled
+        if self.is_wallet_compiled():
+            self.test_getaddressinfo()
 
 
 if __name__ == '__main__':
```
</details>

The test has been changed to use `is_wallet_compiled` and `init_wallet`.

Also added test for `BECH32_INVALID_VERSION` case.

Approach ACK
test was succesful when run on bitcoin-core compiled without wallet (--disable-wallet):
```
2021-09-20T19:30:10.881000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_bha1iotz
2021-09-20T19:30:26.999000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
2021-09-20T19:30:33.380000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_bha1iotz on exit
2021-09-20T19:30:33.380000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
```
Out of curiosity, how did you notice the non-wallet-rpc test is skipped when wallet is not enabled (before your PR)? Thanks @lsilva01.

events.message: skip test_getaddressinfo() if wallet is disabled

rename.from: test: Split rpc_invalid_address_message test into two
rename.to: test: Test if wallet is compiled in rpc_invalid_address_message.py test

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16807](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16807) (Let validateaddress locate error in Bech32 address by meshcollider)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: Let validateaddress locate error in Bech32 address
issue.body:
Addresses (partially) #16779 - no GUI change in this PR

Adds a LocateError function the bech32 library, which is then called by `validateaddress` RPC, (and then eventually from a GUI tool too, future work). I think modifying validateaddress is nicer than adding a separate RPC for this.
Includes tests.

Based on https://github.com/sipa/bech32/blob/master/ecc/javascript/bech32_ecc.js
Credit to sipa for that code

events.body:
tested ACK c2fbdca rpc_invalid_address_message.py checks whether correct error messages are generated for invalid addresses. Since [getaddressinfo](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5b7210c8745d9572fe94620f848d4ee1304c91a7/src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp#L4847) RPC requires a wallet and [validateaddress](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5b7210c8745d9572fe94620f848d4ee1304c91a7/src/rpc/misc.cpp#L788) RPC does not require a wallet, the tests which invoke validateaddress should work even when its compiled without a wallet. This PR fixes the problem by always running the tests which invoke validateaddress and running the tests which invoke getaddressinfo only when the wallet is compiled. Test results when compiled in disable-wallet mode:
On master
``` $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py 2021-10-11T08:20:44.641000Z TestFramework (WARNING): Test Skipped: wallet has not been compiled. 2021-10-11T08:20:44.695000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes 2021-10-11T08:20:44.696000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /var/folders/bh/7x61zw991x15d01dlnx_cgrh0000gn/T/bitcoin_func_test__2uih3yl on exit 2021-10-11T08:20:44.696000Z TestFramework (INFO): Test skipped ```
On c2fbdca
``` $ test/functional/rpc_invalid_address_message.py 2021-10-11T08:55:10.132000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /var/folders/bh/7x61zw991x15d01dlnx_cgrh0000gn/T/bitcoin_func_test_v7gdmep5 2021-10-11T08:55:10.994000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes 2021-10-11T08:55:11.149000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /var/folders/bh/7x61zw991x15d01dlnx_cgrh0000gn/T/bitcoin_func_test_v7gdmep5 on exit 2021-10-11T08:55:11.149000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful ```

issue.title: test: make the node param explicit in init_wallet()
issue.body: This PR changes the definition of `def init_wallet(self, i)` to `def init_wallet(self, *, node)` to make the node parameter explicit, as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22794#discussion_r713287448 .

comments.body: nit: I don't think the comment is needed, when the code is self-explanatory

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -87,7 +84,11 @@ def test_getaddressinfo(self):
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.test_validateaddress()
-        self.test_getaddressinfo()
+
+        # skip if wallet is disabled
+        if self.is_wallet_compiled():
+            self.init_wallet(0)
comments.body:
unrelated to this change, but it might be nice for `init_wallet()` to be defined as

```diff
-    def init_wallet(self, i):
+    def init_wallet(self, *, node):
```
so the calls become `self.init_wallet(node=0)`

use of splat optional, to be decided.

For now there is only a handful of calls to update.
